data.title: Senators emphasize economic opportunities, workforce development in multiple cities
data.meta_description: Arkansas U.S. Senators John Boozman and Tom Cotton will meet with Natural State business, education, and defense industry leaders to highlight economic opportunities and workforce development in the state on Tuesday, Aug. 6, and Wednesday, Aug. 7.
data.text:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (KAIT/Edited News Release) - Arkansas U.S. Senators John Boozman and Tom Cotton will meet with Natural State business, education, and defense industry leaders to highlight economic opportunities and workforce development in the state on Tuesday, Aug. 6, and Wednesday, Aug. 7.

The following dates and times are listed below:

Tuesday, August 6

Event: Tour Arkansas State University Meat Market

This is one of two facilities licensed by the Arkansas Meat Inspection Program to inspect meat products produced for shipment within the state.

Time: 10:30 a.m. – 11 a.m.

Location: University Loop, Jonesboro

Event: Steel Industry Roundtable

Boozman and Cotton along with Congressman Rick Crawford will host a

roundtable discussion with Arkansas steel industry leaders.

Time: Media availability begins at 12:15 p.m.

Location: Arkansas State University, Delta Economic Center

319 University Loop, Jonesboro

Event: Defense Industry Workforce Development Roundtable

Boozman, Cotton, and Congressman Bruce Westerman will join SAU Tech Chancellor Jerry Thomas and local defense industry leaders.

Time: Media availability at 3:30 p.m. at the conclusion of the meeting.

Location: SAU Tech Student Center, 6415 Spellman Road, East Camden

Wednesday, August 7

Event: State Chamber of Commerce Forum

The senators will join industry leaders from around the state to discuss the regulatory climate and its impact on businesses in Arkansas.

Time: 9:30 a.m.

Location: Riggs CAT, 9125 I-30, Little Rock

Event: Compass Cold Storage Facility Tour

The senators will meet with the company’s leadership and tour the cold storage warehouse, which enhances capacity and logistics and serves as a great example of economic investment in the River Valley.

Time: 2:30 p.m.

Location: 507 Industrial Park Dr., Mulberry
